ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a good introductory course, needed for any linguistics major.
Overview of morphological structures with a variety of theoretical views on those structures.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was good learning about some theories of morphology I didn't know anything about, but that part only came by the second part of the semester. I'd add more original literature to the readings, so that we are able to discuss and tackle more complicated problems.
This course challenged me to engage with other theoretical views on familiar structures and engage with new structures I'm not familiar with.
